text:
16 pages of workshops, tips, projects and problem solving

Subly automatically creates embedded subtitles for your videos. Here's what
you need to know

Subly: [getsubly.com](http://getsubly.com) 10 20 mins 1 Any browser

Subtitles aren't only useful for making sense of foreign-language movies.
They're also handy for clarifying dialogue filmed in a noisy environment,
providing the gist of a clip's content when the sound is switched off and,
most importantly, making it possible for someone with hearing difficulties to
follow a conversation.

If you've ever tried to add subtitles to your own videos, you'll know it can
be a time-consuming process. Subly makes things easy by letting you upload a
video to its site and transcribing what's being said to produce editable
subtitles.

You need to create an account to use the service - just enter your email
address, name and a secure password.

Once you've logged in, you can upload your first video. You can only upload
one video at a time. Either drag a video to the window or click the upload
area and navigate to the file you want. You can preview the clip И or clear
the selection И if you want to work on a different video.

Select a language from the dropdown menu. Й Subly supports a range of English-
speaking accents and many European languages. Click Upload, ¾ then wait while
the video is sent. A message lets you know when the upload is completed
successfully and Subly can start transcribing the contents.

While this is happening, you can click the 'Upload a Video' button И and
choose a second clip, if required. A message pops up once the current video
has successfully been transcribed, ¾ and a green Ready label appears. 13 Click
the video thumbnail to view and edit the results.

4 All the subtitles are displayed on the left, next to a time code. Й Click
the Play button on the video H to preview it. The subtitles appear on screen
as it plays. ¾ Hopefully, they are correct, but there may be some mistakes.
Listen out for anything that isn't right.

5 Click any box containing a subtitle that needs changing, then type in the
correct words. Й Changes are saved automatically with a confirmation message.
И Watch the video again to make sure everything is as it should be. You can
customise the look of the text in the 'Style editor'. lį

6From here, you can change the font, size and colour of the subtitles. |1 An
outline И makes the text stand out against the video, and you can pick a
different colour for this, too. You can also format the subtitles, adding
bold, italics and underline, 13 and adjust the alignment. 13

7By default, as is the case with most subtitled movies, the text appears at
the bottom of the video. However, you can change the location to place it at
the top or in the centre, M if that suits your project better. You can also
tweak the margins 13 to make sure everything looks right.

8When you're happy with your finished movie, click the 'Add subtitles to
video' button. Й The subtitles will be 'burned' into the video - this takes
quite a while, depending on how much text there is. You're alerted when the
process is finished. 12 When it's done, you can download the video to your PC.
